This
On
Week
List
Fiction
THE PARTNER, by John Grisham. (Island/Dell, $7.99.) The pursuit of $90 million stolen by a Mississippi lawyer who is hiding in Brazil.
HORNET'S NEST, by Patricia Cornwell. (Berkley, $7.50.) The experiences of two policewomen and a reporter as they patrol the streets of Charlotte, N.C.
THE NOTEBOOK, by Nicholas Sparks. (Warner Vision, $5.99.) A World War II veteran meets an old flame who is about to be married.
AN ANGEL FOR EMILY, by Jude Deveraux. (Pocket, $7.50.) An automobile accident brings heavenly romance to a small-town librarian.
SEA SWEPT, by Nora Roberts. (Jove, $7.50.) Family rivalries flame anew when a champion boat racer returns to help a troubled brother.
CRITICAL JUDGMENT, by Michael Palmer. (Bantam, $6.99.) A physician finds herself investigating the cause of people's murderous rages.
TOM CLANCY'S POWER PLAYS: POLITIKA, created by Tom Clancy and Martin Greenberg. (Berkley, $7.50.) In 1999, an American contends with terrorists threatening his business in Russia.
LITTLE BILL BOOKS FOR BEGINNING READERS, by Bill Cosby. (Cartwheel/Scholastic, $3.99 each.) A series of books for children 6 to 10.
* ACTS OF LOVE, by Judith Michael. (Ivy, $7.99.) The discovery of old letters causes a man and a woman to seek a life together in the theater.
''M'' IS FOR MALICE, by Sue Grafton. (Fawcett, $7.99.) Murder results as sons line up to inherit a family fortune.
A WOMAN'S PLACE, by Barbara Delinsky. (Harper Paperbacks, $7.50.) A successful businesswoman is suddenly deprived of her property and children by a hateful husband.
DREAM A LITTLE DREAM, by Susan Elizabeth Phillips. (Avon, $6.50.) A man and a woman, an unlikely pair, find romance in North Carolina.
ELLEN FOSTER, by Kaye Gibbons. (Vintage, $10.) A girl learns self-reliance growing up with wicked relatives in the backwoods South.
*TOTAL CONTROL, by David Baldacci. (Warner Vision, $7.50.) A woman's effort to find her husband reveals the ways of big business.
A VIRTUOUS WOMAN, by Kaye Gibbons. (Vintage, $10.) A widow finds love with an older man.

On
Week
List
NonFiction
JAMES CAMERON'S TITANIC, by Ed W. Marsh. Photographs by Douglas Kirkland. (Harper Perennial, $20.) The making of the film.
UNDER THE TUSCAN SUN, by Frances Mayes. (Broadway, $13.) Life in the Italian countryside.
THE COLOR OF WATER, by James McBride. (Riverhead, $12.) A black writer remembers growing up with his white mother in Brooklyn.
UNDAUNTED COURAGE, by Stephen E. Ambrose. (Touchstone/S&S, $16.) The story of how Thomas Jefferson sponsored Lewis and Clark. (+)
INTO THE WILD, by Jon Krakauer. (Anchor/ Doubleday, $12.95.) How a young man's obsession with the wilderness had a tragic end.
A CIVIL ACTION, by Jonathan Harr. (Vintage, $13.) A lawsuit brought by Massachusetts householders against industrial polluters. (+)
IN THE NAME OF LOVE, by Ann Rule. (Pocket, $6.99.) Five true-crime cases.
* ANATOMY OF THE SPIRIT, by Caroline Myss. (Three Rivers, $14.) The importance of holistic ''energy medicine.'' (+)
HANSON: THE OFFICIAL BOOK, by Jarrod Gollihare. (Billboard, $10.95.) A profusely illustrated account of the pop-rock trio.
*GIRLFRIENDS, by Carmen Renee Berry and Tamara Traeder. (Wildcat Canyon, $12.95.) The ties that bind women of all ages and all kinds.
A CHILD CALLED ''IT,'' by Dave Pelzer. (Health Communications, $9.95.) The autobiography of a man who survived his mother's abuse.
TAYLOR HANSON, by Nancy Krulik. (Archway/Pocket, $3.99.) A biography of Hanson's lead singer.
* UNDERBOSS, by Peter Maas. (Harper Paperbacks, $6.99.) Life in the Mafia as lived and observed by Salvatore (Sammy the Bull) Gravano.
A NIGHT TO REMEMBER, by Walter Lord. (Bantam, $5.99.) A historian's account of the Titanic disaster.
REVIVING OPHELIA, by Mary Pipher. (Ballantine, $12.50.) The dangers for teen-age girls. (+)
*SPONTANEOUS HEALING, by Andrew Weil. (Fawcett, $12.95.) How the body heals itself. (+)
*HANSON, by Jill Matthews. (Archway/Pocket, $3.99.) The story of the pop-rock group.

Advice, How-To and Miscellaneous
DON'T SWEAT THE SMALL STUFF . . . AND IT'S ALL SMALL STUFF, by Richard Carlson. (Hyperion, $9.95.) How to enjoy life more and contribute to the world we live in. (+)
DR. ATKINS' NEW DIET REVOLUTION, by Robert C. Atkins. (Avon, $6.50.) Ways to lose weight and achieve a healthy body.
CHICKEN SOUP FOR THE TEENAGE SOUL, compiled by Jack Canfield, Mark Victor Hansen and Kimberly Kirberger. (Health Communications, $12.95.) Inspirational stories. (+)
THE WORLD ALMANAC AND BOOK OF FACTS 1998. (World Almanac/K-III Reference, $9.95.) The 130th annual edition.

Rankings reflect sales, for the week ending Jan. 17, at almost 4,000 bookstores plus wholesalers serving 60,000 other retailers, statistically weighted to represent all such outlets. An asterisk (*) indicates that a book's sales are barely distinguishable from those of the book above. A dagger (+) indicates that some stores received bulk orders. Expanded rankings are available from The New York Times on the Web: www.nytimes.com/books.
